steps.title: Pervasive
steps.text: Pervasive is a new keyword that appears on some enemies in the Colour Out of Oz campaign. Pervasive enemies are put into play next to the agenda deck and are considered to be at each location following the keyword. Pervasive enemies always have the massive keyword as well to avoid engagement issues. Investigators still cannot interact with investigators at other locations during tests against a pervasive enemy that is at both locations. (ex. Pervasive -- Each [[First Floor]] location.)

steps.title: Decay X
steps.text: Decay X is a new keyword that appears on some scenario cards in the Colour Out of Oz campaign. The Decay X keyword is followed by a connected effect. (ex. Decay 1 -- Deal 2 damage to each investigator at this location.)

bullets.text: A card with Decay X enters play with X horror on it.
At the start of the upkeep phase, remove 1 horror from each card with Decay X.
At the end of the round, resolve the connected effect of each card with Decay X and no horror on it. This effect is considered to be a forced effect for the purposes of other game effects.

steps.title: Companion
steps.text: Companion is a new keyword that appears on some story assets in the Colour Out of Oz campaign. During some scenarios, these assets will be in play next to the act deck and are not considered to be at any one location. Abilities on companion assets cannot be activated except through abilities that specifically reference them.

steps.title: Fatigue
steps.text: In the Colour Out of Oz campaign, companions gain fatigue over the course of the campaign, representing their own trauma while facing the Colour. Some cards and resolutions will instruct players to add fatigue to specific companion assets in the Campaign Log. This is done by checking the appropriate boxes on the second page of the Campaign Log. Fatigue has no game effect except when explicitly referenced by the Campaign Guide or by a card effect. Each companion cannot have more than 5 fatigue marked to their name. If at any point a companion reaches 5 fatigue, cross that companion's name off in the Campaign Log. Companions with crossed off names cannot be chosen during scenario setups or have corresponding sections in the Campaign Guide read. Companions in play that reach 5 fatigue during a scenario are immediately removed from the game.
Cross out Cap'n Bill in the Campaign Log.
Cross out Jack Pumpkinhead in the Campaign Log.
Cross out Shaggy Man in the Campaign Log.
Cross out The Cowardly Lion in the Campaign Log.
Cross out The Frogman in the Campaign Log.
Cross out The Hungry Tiger in the Campaign Log.
Cross out The Patchwork Girl in the Campaign Log.
Cross out The Sawhorse in the Campaign Log.
Cross out The Scarecrow in the Campaign Log.
Cross out The Tin Woodman in the Campaign Log.
Cross out The Wizard in the Campaign Log.
Cross out Tik-Tok in the Campaign Log.

steps.title: Investigator Setup
steps.text: As a reminder, each investigator listed should follow the following setup changes:

effects.text: #name# adds 1 [curse] token to the chaos bag.

choices.text: Did an investigator take control of School Pills during this scenario?

steps.text: Any investigator may choose to add School Pills to their deck. This card does not count toward that investigator's deck size.
